ofx:section.ofx:title: Version Control System (SVN)
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Version Control System (SVN) is a software versioning and revision control system, that helps software developers to work together and maintain a complete history of their work.
During the usage of SVN, there are a lot of specific terms you have to work with. The most important are explained below.

l:item.ofx:paragraph: A repository is the central place where the project itself and the history is stored. It is accessed over a network and acting as a server. Clients can connect to the repository and store/receive all changes.
The trunk is the main directory and contains all necessary project files. It is usually checked out to work on the project.
The Synchronize with Repository view shows all changes between local project version and server version. You have the opportunities to update/commit all changes or to revert conflicted files.
Commit is a process of storing changes from the local project to central server. After you commit your changes, these are available for the team.
During the update process, users receive commited changes to their local working copy.
